video: 1920x800 AVC
audio1 (default): movie plus Rifftrax AAC 2.0
audio2: just movie AAC 5.1 (Twilight1 5.1 is AC3)
audio3: just movie AAC 2.0
subs: English built in, off by default, not hard coded, software switchable
intro: 1s after the last riff comment
Riffers: Bill Corbett, Kevin Murphy, Mike Nelson 

This version2 has the following changes:
* newly remastered 2.0 Riff track using Chris's Dynamic Compressor on the movie and Level Speech on the riffs
* new 2.0 Riff audio track has more balanced and understandable riff and movie dialog
* the volume range for the riffs is more consistent so even very quiet riff words are clear
* the v2 movie audio has better fidelity, especially in loud parts which aren't as loud as v1
* the quietest movie dialog is now louder and easier to hear
* v2 2.0 Riff bitrates are 15-25% higher than v1

This is a remux with the Rifftrax commentary added as the default audio track. The Rifftrax audio tracks have been newly remastered to ensure the riff comments are just loud enough to be clear when the movie is loud and not too loud when the movie is quiet. Please leave any feedback regarding the Rifftrax audio remastering.

Note for Twilight4 the riffing of the credits using over the top Volturi voices pushed the Rifftrax intro comments longer than the total running time. The picture is just black during this final bit.

Big thanks to the posters of the 1080p/5.1 encodes of the movies, the subs and the chapters.
